Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to getting around Rome”
Reviews.Author: elitetrav
Reviews.Content: We had one of the "older rooms" in the hotel, so you thought you were going back in time to the 40's. Aside from the flat screen TV, the room had a very old feel to it, but it was super clean, so we got passed the decor, and focused on the staff and location, both of which were excellent. The lobby and dining areas were much more updated, however, and we enjoyed the breakfast selection, (although eggs anywhere in Italy are not the same) The location is a block from the main train and bus station, so getting around the city is ideal from here, plus you are on one of the main avenues with many destinations within a nice walk. The metro system nearby, was fantastic, and the front desk staff mapped out the proper trains for us to take to get to all the major sights. We really enjoyed stayting here, and would come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two Stays - Two Opinions”
Reviews.Author: KarynB
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here twice within a week of each other. Make sure you get a refurbished room! The first room I had was so depressing that I just wanted to leave, it was so small I could barely fit inside. I am not a large person by any means but the bed was so tiny I could hardly turn over. The only saving grace was the roof top bar where we had a fantastic lunch (though I mainly remember to champagne). I was very nervous knowing I was coming back to stay here in a couple of days time that I nearly booked another hotel. Thankfully when I checked back in I got an upgrade! What a difference, this room was nearly 5 times the size with a large double bed. What a difference this upgrade made, well worth doing if you get the option. Breakfast is good, however be aware that this hotel caters for a lot of tour groups so if you have an early or urgent depature you night want to get to the restaurant early. The location is perfect for those traveling by eurorail. Within a 3 minute walk fromt the station and really centrally located - you can walk almost anywhere you wanted to sight see.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: tomsdad101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five nights. Check-in was pleasant. Originally were offered a 6th floor room facing a small street, but after I mentioned my requests at booking time for an 8th floor room they offered me a viewing of both the 6th and 8th floor rooms. The 8th floor room had large french windows with a bit of a view of roof tops, so we took that. Room size was large with high ceilings with broad corridors and lobby on each floor for a European hotel. It got pretty warm during the daytime in the room with the sun coming in the morning thru the french windows, but we were mostly out during daytime. My wife felt this was somewhat of an issue, although by midnight it was cool enough to need sheets to cover ourselved during sleep. The cot supplied for our 21 month old boy was a bit quaint and small with metal railings without padding, fortunately he didnt bang his head on it during the stay! He really enjoyed running in the long corridors on our floor daily, mainly people free when we had him out. The breakfast was average with good cappucino out of a machine being the highlight. Breakfast room however was a very pleasant traditionally done up place with a lot of character, so were the lobby areas on the ground floor with a touch of grandness. I read a couple of reviews about the hotel being dated, but I think they missed the point of deliberately traditional decor - facilities were all up to date and well maintained as was the building itself, although a number of older features from the date of the original build were carefully preserved. Staff in the breakfast room were always smiley and friendly; at reception were always polite and answered questions reasonably clearly in English although not always smiley. Highlight was piedmont style beef stew with potatoes on the roof top restaurant with view of the city on our first night - a touch on the expensive side, but was delicious. Another highlight was the room cleaning service, which was daily and excellent. Other highlights appreciated were the bathroom facilities including bidet. Although we had a bath in ours, I felt I re-discovered the pleasures of showing with their excellent fixed shower, and had only one bath. Also the free wi-fi was appreciated, we used it on my wife's iphone, although we had to get a new password every couple of days. We ate 3 nights in 2 restaurants in a nearby street with good food in one and average to good food in the other, both at reasonable prices (€40 approx for 2 with house wine or beer included). Main negative was the city tax at the end of the stay: €30 was charged - we were not made aware of this by the commercial hotel booking site we used which implied all charges were paid for, and the hotel itself made us aware of this at the time of check out and not before. Worth spending for one dinner on the top floor restaurant, with night lights of Rome to look over - only dont expect to see any of the monuments lit up as too many surrounding buildings around the monuments to catch a glimpse from this area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable with great views from the bar on floor 10”
Reviews.Author: Skier0
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel having left another hotel which we had been booked into by a travel company, and spent 2 nights enjoying the comfort and spaciousness of the Mediterraneo. The bedroom was large and the bathroom, which offered bath and shower was always well cleaned. The view from the 10th floor bar and restaurant was great, with fine views of the Colosseum and Vatican. The staff were always friendly and polite, and could not have been more helpful. Breakfast was quite a feast and set us up for the day. The location of the hotel next to Terminii station meant that it was sometimes quite a walk to see the sights of Rome, but then it always seems better to walk in Rome anyway as the traffic can be quite hectic, or of course there is the option of the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel well situated in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: dajtodd
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my wife and I have stayed in this hotel and on this occasion we were accompanied by friends. Whilst the purpose of these visits is to see the Italy v England six nations rugby match it is also a good opportunity for site seeing. The hotel is ideally located close to Termini station and within easy walking distance of most of the historical sites of Rome. The rooms are spacious and clean and tidy and the air condition works! The very varied breakfast is more than you could reasonably ask for and the bar is spacious and comfotrable. Whilst the bar prices are high the waiter service is very good and friendly. The staff in reception are more than helpful and my wife and I would happily stay in this hotel again in 2 years time if England Rugby Supporters are running a trip to this venue.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: 5252orange
Reviews.Content: Only stayed a night, but the location next to the train station can't be beat. Be sure to have a drink in the trippy bar. The breakfast buffet was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lach_arvada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights here; he was working and I was a tourist. It is only is a block from Termini train station, which is the city's transportation hub. Subway lines, taxis, buses, trams, tourist buses and the train from the airport all stop in or near Termini. The hotel has a very nice lobby, the front desk staff all speak English well. Our room, which was on the 8th floor, was clean, comfortable and surprisingly quiet for a busy street. Breakfast was assorted breads, meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, juices, scrambled eggs, bacon, American coffee and espresso. We ate dinner at a different small restaurant in the area each night; all were very good. When we needed to eat quickly, we got a sandwich and gelato in Termini. We recommend the Mediterraneo Hotel and will stay here the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, friendly staff, walking distance to the Colosseum, great food AND a rooftop overlooking Rome ...”
Reviews.Author: Natalina777
Reviews.Content: Mediterraneo Hotel on Via Cavour must be one of the best hotels in all of Rome. Convenience (about a 1.5 minute walk from the train station, and a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum) mixed with kindness from the staff make this hotel an ideal spot for your stay in Rome. Enjoy a gourmet meal on the roof during sunset with a distant St. Peters as your backdrop. I have stayed at this hotel with groups and on my own and would suggest it to anyone looking for an affordable spot to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katekotz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights in 02/2011 and the hotel was very nice. The staff was friendly and helpful with booking excursions, taxi calls and money exchange. We arrived in the morning and our room wasn't ready yet so we did have to wait a couple of hours, but the concierge led us into the restaurant and let us have breakfast free of charge, which was nice. The only thing that I would have to complain about was I did not receive the room that I had booked online through Expedia. The room however, was very large and very clean and had a nice view of Via Cavour, a very bustling, lively street. I would recommend the hotel to anyone. It was in a convenient area, close to major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not as wonderful as it sounds...”
Reviews.Author: Tripwell
Reviews.Content: Only thing going for this hotel is the service and possible location if you want to be near the Termini. Room was tiny, dark and facing some side street. No view. Decor was old and poor. Bathroom- hardly! Just a practical place to stay

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: pat60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mediterraneo for one night prior to a cruise. This hotel is well-maintained, the rooms are a little larger than traditional European rooms, the public areas are lovely, and the staff was wonderful. The elevators were also a little larger than some of the other European hotels at which we have stayed. It is situated very close to Termini train station and the local buses. We had not trouble catching a bus to Piazza Navona, which was a short walk to the Pantheon and other tourist sites. Up the street (opposite direction from the train station) are two important churches that are within walking distance (one is St. Peter in Chains and I think that the other is Santa Maria Maggiore, but I'm not certain). We plan to stay at this hotel again when we are next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “old”
Reviews.Author: ivana622
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean , but very old . Not very close to anything but the train station . With so many choices in Rome , I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel--Staff seemed super!!”
Reviews.Author: HamTraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here after a cruise on the Wind Star of the Mediterranian. Very good location. Jump On-Jump off bus was a half block away. Pharmacia right there! Nice room. When I complained that it was too warm and when I opened the window I got a blast of sewer gas. The manager (Mr. Garbo), went over and above by moving us to a suite that had a rooftop terrace. Gotta love those Italians!!! Breakfast superb!! Almost the best food in my four day stay. Watch out for pickpockets and muggers in Rome. My wife almost lost her pendant and gold chain to a wouldbe thief. All he got for his efforts was a punch by her and she didnt lose anything but her temper. A 67year old pit bull. Thank God she didnt get hurt. Travel safely and have a good visit in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Met all of our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Niagaranomad
Reviews.Content: This is a traditional European style hotel with plenty of character on the inside and a great location to the outside. Often , the area around the main railway station can create safety concerns but we did not feel that was an issue. The location on the Via Cavour provided access to major sites by walking or by using the Metro. This hotel also has a reasonably priced rooftop bar with excellent views of the city. We had an excellent and spacious ( for European standards) room which was surprisingly quiet given the busy neighbourhood. An excxellent buffet breakfast was provided and the staff was extremely cogenial (especially Walter at the front desk). We were with a group of twenty and each evening they provided us with glasses and a conference breakout room so that we could take our own wines to a goup "happy hour". We certainly would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel with beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: nevin t
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights at this hotel and we were not disapointed. The location , breakfast and the roof bar were very good. Termini train station is just few meters away from the hotel. And it ıs possible to go to the historical attraction points by walk such as La Fontana Di Travi, Campi di Fiori,Spanish Steps and Roman Forum. Overall, ıt was a very nice experience in such an amazing city

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.....”
Reviews.Author: khristian14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older historic ambiance. From the outside it seems a bit unattractive, however on entering the lobby/reception area, you get the sense of the Italian culture. The hotel is gracefully appointed large rooms and the location is perfect either to reach Terminin Station or to walk to some of the highlights of Rome, i.e the Colliseum, Spanish Steps, a few churches etc. Buffet breakfast was excellent, dining service there was remarkable. The view from the rooftop restaurant was lovely. The area surrounding the hotel is very lively and can be a bit crazy at nights. There are quite a few souvenir shops around and a adequate selection of restaurants quaint and intermit in the mix. To sum it up this was a lovely stay and worth the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, not old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: X_Amgirl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three day visit in Rome. The hotel is by the train station,conveniently located close to where the bus from the airport stopped. City bus to down town runs from the same area, but front desk people at the hotel advised us not to come back by bus after dark but rather take a taxi. As we all know a train station is a place for many "different" people, homeless and outcasts. The hotel looked like something from way back then...dark wood etc. It looked like they had kept it the way it was from the beginning, quite some time ago. The double room was nice and clean, but the bed very hard. Warm and cold water were connected incorrectly, but it was not a big deal. To shower required a bit of gymnastic. There was a shower in the bath tub, but the problem was that the shower head was mounted on the wall without a house and it was placed a 160 cm up on the wall. I am 170 cm and with the bathtub being vaulted on the sides I had to bend backwards with bent knees to get my hair under the shower. We were laughing trying to imagine someone much taller do the same thing. Breakfast was okay for us and probably more so for someone who loves bread. We would have preferred if they had had fresh sliced fruits They did have a fruit basket though. The cleaning of the room consisted of pulling up our cover (not making the bed) and changing the hand towels in the bathroom. We did not care, but still... we booked this hotel through Agoda and payed 208 euro per night. A plus for this hotel - if you have your walking shoes on you can walk from this hotel to most any of Rome´s tourist attractions. X_Am.Girl

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: korybak
Reviews.Content: We stayed her 2 weeks ago and had a very nice time. We were on a Globus tour so it was chosen for us. Very near Termini which was good and bad. The n'hood changed quickly but we never felt unsafe, and it was near lots of good, small restaurants. Lots of action nearby. It was also easy to find our way to the historical center with the Forum and Colisseum. Our room was spacious and so was the bathroom with very nice plumbing. The front desk staff was very busy but pleasant when it was my turn. Very good restaurant recommendations, too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: bapmiami
Reviews.Content: We had one great last night in Roma at this hotel. The hotel is huge and beautiful and has a fabulous view from the rooftop. We didn't dine in the restaurant but went up to see the view. The rooms are nice and bathrooms are beautiful and clean and the furniture is ok.The lobby and amenities are very nice. Wifi is very slow from the computers downstairs but if you have a phone or laptop you can connect from your room at a faster service and its free. We got a great nights sleep and its in a safe section of Roma with a 200 meter walk from train station. I would give it a 4 star rating. Also we had to be out early so they gave us without asking a packed breakfast for our early departure with pastries, fruit and eggs. What a nice touch!! Extremely helpful and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sassafraf
Reviews.Content: I had been told that all the hotels in Rome were old and many run down The Mediterraneo was not a stylish hotel and it was old but we didn't mind it at all the foyer was tastfully decorated with large comfy velvet chairs to relaxe on while waiting for tour buses to arrive Breakfast while not fancy was plenty everything to satisfy the hungry tourist and a special choice breakfast for those having to watch their diets There were 3 computers free of charge and a lovely though expensive restaurant up on the roof with an excellent view over the city of Rome Our room was very average but the bed was comfy as were the pillows plenty hot water towels tissues soaps etc the shower did splash out a little water from the taps was alright for drinking Only complaint the lifts were very small and slow not allowed to take your large bags up in these and we found the porters and those working for the hotel a little off handed not many smiles out of this lot

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: imerk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very near to the train station, yet is in a very well lit and much safer area than others. The rooms are HUGE for Rome. Very tall ceilings. They cater to the British and Germans primarily; lots of tour groups. Breakfast was good, service was excellent and the view from the rooftop restraunt was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - close to Train and Bus terminal”
Reviews.Author: chryaven
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel, although it was a bit old. We were given vouchers for a free Welcome Drink at their Roof top bar which was lovely. Great views of the city. The room was spacious and pretty comfortable. Furniture is from the 1960's era, very mod and retro, but everything worked fine. Bathroom were clean and spacious, although not so modern. Still use Shower curtains in the bathtub. But overall we were very impressed. Breakfast was very complete with eggs, bacon, cold cuts, pastries etc etc. Very impressed although it gets very crowded. Overall, a nice hotel in a convenient location. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Service, convenience, and comfort”
Reviews.Author: OldDukeDoc
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from the metro, train, and bus hub. Large, well-appointed room with a rare comfortable bed. Free breakfast even included eggs. Lobby has comfortable and inviting lounge areas and bar. Staff was very friendly and helpful, especially if you try to use Italian. The hotel manager invited us up to the roof for a flyby of the Italian Air Force to commemorate the unification of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotia_10
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Rome where we stayed with the fine people of the Hotel Mediterraneo for six nights. This is a well appointed hotel with beautiful furnishings and many extras. The breakfast buffet ( free) is the best we have encountred in Italy with a good variety of hot and cold foods, although they could stand to cook their bacon a bit more crispy. Lots of eggs,both boiled and scrambled, toast, s cereals, yogurts, and assortment of breads. We had a superior room and were fortunate enough ( Thank you Sonia) to have room 816 which had a very large patio from which we could veiw the domes of Mary Major church from one side and a good view of the city all around. Loved this part and having the patio added so much to our trip it is certainly worth mentioning. The roof terrace dining room looked beautiful but as we were traveling with five, and most entrees were in the 30 Euro range, we did not have the opportunity to try this. It sure smelled great from our patio though. The area, close to termini, has been knocked by some reviewers but there are some definate plusses as well. termini is a great landmark and everyone can direct you to it if required. All of the buses going everywhere, as well as the trains, leave from here, Via nationale is a very short walk away ( good shopping) as is the colluseum, and other attractions if you don't mind a 10-15 minute walk. There are plenty of good restuarants in the area but try Electra, and there is another right acros the street but I cannot remeber the name ( sorry) Stay away from Il Condor, they are crooks. My risotto was awful, inediable, so they took it away and brought me ravioli ( their choice) and when we were done the girl apologized and brought three cheesecake to our table as well as a cappicino for me. Problem was, we were charged for the ravioli, the cheesecake, and the capacino. Fool me once, shame on you. Anyway, I would highly recommend this hotel and the restuarants mentioned. Hope this helps someone, espcially regarding the Il Condor restuarant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: debdoodleNewYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right near the train hub and area to catch the double decker busses. It was easy to navigate from the hotel at night to "venture" out. Hotel was clean. Breakfast buffet was good. Nice seating area to "hang out" with friends. Two computers in lobby with free internet. Rooms were neat, clean and spacious (for Europe).

Reviews.Title: “No problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtomicTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly decent hotel - good clean rooms with aircon, nice public areas, good breakfast selection, and free wifi. It's located near termini (for the main train station, metro and taxis) but in a better part than some other hotels. Around the hotel are numerous bars and restaurants, and the centre of Rome is easily walkable in about 10-15 mins. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Italytwin
Reviews.Content: For Globus Tour members, this hotel was very nice for groups meeting in the lounge. The complimentary breakfast was good and the dining area fills up fast. The hotel is within walking distance to the metro and train station, but is not close to any tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for independent touring of Rome”
Reviews.Author: laiyw
Reviews.Content: if going to Rome stay here, it's easy to get to all the major attractions Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colloseum, the hop on hop off tour buses are just around the corner and the roof top garden gives you fab views accross the city at night

Reviews.Title: “Could be nice, but won't return for the price”
Reviews.Author: KatesRoy
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, and it's very close to the train station, but the service was a bit rude, and it's three times the price of other hotels I've enjoyed in the area. The restaurant on top has lovely views, and the waitstaff are very nice, but it's expensive as well. Bottom line, you can get the same or better service, etc. for a fraction of the price. Also, the internet expires frequently and you have to get new passwords often.

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Farmermark
Reviews.Content: This is a great property. Nice hotel with good size rooms and bathrooms, helpful staff, and a very convenient location. What the location lacks in charm, it makes up for in convenience. The hotel is right across the street from Termini Station the main train station in Rome so getting to and from the Airport was easy and more affordable than a taxi. Bus, metro and trolley stops are all right across the street. You might think there would be lots of noise in the room but the windows are double plated so noise is not an issue. Air conditioning worked well. Breakfast was really good with breads, cereals, cold meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacaon and more. The lobby is large and there is free wifi as well as computers to use in the lobby. Lots of good restaruants to eat at around the area...again not really an area with charm but still very good food. If the hotel has a downside its the beds...they are hard. Pillows are good but the mattresses are hard so if you are very particular about soft mattresses then this isn't the place for you. One recommendation. If you are going to do bus tours around the city use the Green Line Tour company. We used 2 different companies and liked Green Line better. They were more organized, with newer buses, and right accross the street from the hotel. One more thing...This was my 3rd trip to Rome and my first visit to Ville D'Este in Tivoli...well worth the tour to Tivoli. Also have dinner in Piazza Novana, it is just a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lexie2028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mediterraneo Hotel with my partner during a business conference. The hotel is in an ideal location...2 blocks from Roma Termini. The hotel is rated as a 4 star..but it certainly is not a 4 star by North American standards. This large hotel only has 2 elevators and you can wait excessively long to get elevator service due to the large numbers of group tours that check in and out. So if you're in a hurry...you will likely need to take the stairs which we were required to do on a number of occasions. This hotel has 10 stories and we were on the 5th floor. The first time we used the shower...the water went up to our calves because the drain was plugged. The hand towels...are not really towels..they are more like a thin dish cloth...and if you're looking for a face cloth...forget it, there are none. I called downstairs to ask for a disposable razor, as I forgot mine. Even though they advertise the fact that they will provide you with disposable razors, shaving cream, toothbrush, toothpaste etc...if you have forgotten them, I was told by the front desk that I could buy those things across the street. After a lengthy conversation..they finally agreed to bring one up to my room. As we were on business, we needed to iron some clothes and asked for an iron and ironing board...something I expect from a 4 star hotel. We were told that irons were not allowed in the room because "it may blow up"..I can only assume they were referring to the circuit breakers. We were told that if we needed something ironed..they had staff to do it for a fee. There is no way I was willing to pay someone to iron a pair of pants...something I do on a regular basis. The roof terrace restaurant only has 4 tables to accommodate people that want a drink at the end of the night....it's a lovely view but you certainly pay for it. The buffet breakfast is average. On a positive note, there is a small gym which provides everything you need, equipment wise. The air conditioning is fantastic and the rooms are soundproofed...giving you a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Backpacker52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mediterraneo Hotel last october and I thought it was good choice. The hotel is located a walk distance from Termini Station, a good option for them that arrive by train. It is also a walk distance from major attractions. Room and bathroom are confortables. And it has also a very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Collette Tour”
Reviews.Author: KNICKRD
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Collette tour of Rome and Amalfi. If you are into tours, this would be the one to do. It was our first time to Italy, and the tour was very informative, I don't know how we have have seen all that we did, without the tour. Tracy was incredible, and Pepe our driver was death defying. The Hotels, such as the Mediterraneo were nice, I wouldn't say 4 stars, but 3. the restaurant/bar on the roof was nothing to speak of, and really no view. But there really wasn't a view from anywhere, your not in a scenic part of town. It is easy to get around, either by foot or Metro. There didn't appear to be any problem with pickpockets or beggars. The breakfast in the Hotel was a very nice buffet of fruit, cereals, and even eggs.

Reviews.Title: “An American's Review: Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: GovieTravler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by an Italian business acquaintance. It did not disappoint, but was not a typical American style hotel, either. It is an excellent choice if you are arriving at Termini Station and don't want to drag your luggage any further; it is just a few steps away. Pros: Staff speaks English, interesting artwork in lobby, nice wooden furniture in room, good climate control, full size bath with adequate water temperature and pressure and many food establishments on the same block. It is a 20 minute walk down hill to the Colosseum or you can take a bus to any of the attractions from Termini. Adequate: Breakfast buffet was fine, but who wants hotel food in Rome. The gym included a treadmill and multi-weight machine. Elevators are slow; on one occasion the door opened on the 6th floor and would not shut for an unknown reason. Cons: Rates seemed high if you don't have an Italian speaker who can negotiate a better deal. No tourist sights in immediate vicinity. Bed was not particularly comfortable. The desk was a bit difficult to use since it was a wooden fold-out. There were limited outlets and the internet required constant attention with entering access codes. I'll make a reservation here on my next trip to Rome. With few chains around, I would not be sure about the quality of other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was adequate but would not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: samuk82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate, it was clean and close to the Collessium. Parts of our room were a bit shabby like the lamps and carpet, when we run the shower for the first time the water was running brown and the room got cold at night and we only had a thin cover on the bed. On 2 out of 3 mornings we were awoken at 6:30am by workmen working on scaffolding outside our room and the view was of not very clean buildings. The area was quite rough with a lot of graffiti on surrounding buildings. There were a couple of restaurants nearby which were ok. The rooftop terrace restaurant was not open, the restaurant was situated on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “smart hotel, cold room”
Reviews.Author: JulianLeicester
Reviews.Content: This is a smart looking hotel with large attractive public spaces. We had booked a superior room, and it was large and looked good. The bed was pretty hard. The room was cold and had no effective means of heating: the air con could not be set above 21 C, and anyway the room never got near this temperature. We were there during an unusually cool interval, but everywhere else in the hotel was a good temperature. From our room (206) we could hear the lift arrival bell every time. There was free WiFi. The breakfasts were perfectly adequate. The hotel is one of the many near the main train station, but its a pleasant longish walk to the Colosseum. We found ourselves getting taxis quite a bit, Rome is small enough that the costs seemed resonable (expecially given the sparse metro coverage).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: RachelPeckham
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights earlier this year. The hotel is nice, and in a great spot close to Termini Station, and also the stop for all the tour buses! The room was clean and a good size. The only negative point was that the air conditioning (even though we didn't have it on) was very noisy. Hotel was good value, although we did get a very reasonably priced deal with Buckshaw Travel. Would stay again, as it is in such a good location for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for tourtists - Excelente ubicacion para turistas”
Reviews.Author: Tequila4me
Reviews.Content: I have been many times at Mediterraneo Hotel, staff is excellent, professional and very polite, most of them speak at least 3 languages, Lobby bar is particularly lonely, but barmen are great (Franco and Alberto). Buffet Breakfast is complementary, and is plenty! nothing to envy to luxury hotels around. Rooms are small....but that's often on all over Europe cities. Located on Via Cavour is really close to Termini station and both subway lines converge at it. Leonardo Express is a all day train from and to Fumiccino Airport, First in the morning is at 5:15 am and last at 12:00am, so its easy to catch a plane for just 8 euros. At walking distance to Santa Maria La Mayor Church, and Colosseo. Super markets on Via Cavour as well as souvenirs stores, even a laundry coins machines just a block away. Termini Station is crowed 24 hours, so stores, fast food (McDonals) restaurants and drugstore are open till midnight even late. Its safe to walk around Via Cavour, but watch out with "extra comunitarios" people who has come ilegaly from non Europe Community Countries. All tours Buses (Rouge Car, Green Bus) stop in front Termini Station, so you can easily take any touristic route and get back Hotel at final of day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, spacious rooms, very helpful staff, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: aalexmik
Reviews.Content: Professional staff, bar and restaurant on premises, large "old European" style rooms nicely furnished including modern amenities, great wi-fi access. We're glad we booked this hotel and will return as often as possible. It's a good affordable place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: holidayfunMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a Trafalgar Tour. The location is in a seedy area opposite the Termini railway station. It was a large hotel therefore I found quite impersonal compared to the boutique hotel I had been staying at the nights prior. The hotel plumbing was very noisy so every time someone turned on a tap, the whole room started vibrating. As a result, I did not sleep well. The furniture in the room was old as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: thequeencat
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood is terrible. The only thing close by is the train station. The first room they gave us was not even made up yet, the second I had to clean the bathtub. The staff are completely disinterested in the guests and the concierge is down right rude.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station”
Reviews.Author: Ozstudent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just across the road from the main train station, perfect if you plan on taking day trips though it did take some walking to get to the Rome sights. The staff were efficient, although definitely not as friendly as other hotels I stayed at. The room was a good size, including a decent sized bathroom, though the flush on the toilet was a bit temperamental and the plug in the bath didn't close. If you stay here, you have to go and have a drink on the roof at sunset. The view is breathtaking! I stayed for dinner, which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel till the receptionist reduced me to tears”
Reviews.Author: elimeli
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel from an ant riddled apartment with no AC ( it was 40 degree heat) so loved the suite and the air conditioning -i t was like Heaven. The rooms are cleaned with fresh sheets every day and the breakfast is OK. However 2 days before we were due to check out the AC broke down. After being assured it would be fixed I woke up at 4.30 am to an unbreathable room. The man at front desk gave me and the kids another room for the rest of the night, and said the AC in our own room would be fixed by morning. We went out next day came back at 7pm to no AC in room. I went down to reception 4 times after being told its on from the male receptionist. I finally had enough and asked for another room. He had obviously had enough of dealing with me so set his associate on me, a fierce woman with no patience. She was not speaking to me, she was screaming at me. She roared they can not accommodate my party size blah blah and I was so frustrated with her I burst into tears. At this point miraculously (or through embarrassment) she suddenly found a room. What were the odds, eh? I complained the next day at check out and the lady I spoke to was very apologetic and took the last nights cost off our bill. Apart from this upset this Hotel was well situated for Termini, so made getting around easy. I would actually stay here again. All the other staff were helpful and friendly (apart from tweedIe dum and tweedle dee on night shift) but I suggest to any potential guests that they brush up on acting lessons to turn on the tears if they are not as tired and emotional as I was haha.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location......”
Reviews.Author: lmoney
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for travel to downtown and sites. Staff very friendly and helpful Rooms clean, a little bit of mustiness in room but not bad. Breakfast included was good, fruit and variety of food, room very crowded though when tour bus crowd in. Walls are paper thin in rooms so could hear other people very well. I would recommend this hotel as a centre fro a few days touring in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: BrainSnag
Reviews.Content: This hotel like many near Rome Termini is really nothing special. It's a worn out 1930s era hotel that has had very little done in improvements. A musty smell with a waft of mildew is all throughout the hotel. You get used to it, so after a few days it is no longer an issue. Staying near Termini is convenient, but there are many lousy restaurants in the area and I have to say that the best food I had in Rome by far was Chinese food at the Hong Kong Cafe across the street from Termini. Perhaps I should have done some research regarding my dinner choices, but my opinion is that any reasonably priced restaurants in Rome are really pretty lousy. 3 slices of pizza with sausage (hot dog slices) and 2 ice teas priced out at 28 Euro in a place around the corner from the hotel. So beware of the tourist oriented snack bars and restaurants. Really a step down after our stay in Paris. I refer to Italy as a 2 1/2 world country, really far less sophisticated than France and the UK. Air conditioning was iffy at best, "frigobar" didn't really work either. Would definitely spend a bit more money and upgrade to something closer to the primary shopping areas of Rome and escape the tourist rip-off areas around Termini which are littered with graffiti, hostels, and mediocre restaurants. Free breakfast was adequate and worth what I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre/Post Cruise Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BevHowarth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent for our pre cruise stay in Rome. Lovely hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. We booked our flights with Ryanair and flew to Ciampano airport 2 days before our cruise to give us plenty of time for any delays and also a look around Rome. (We should have booked this hotel for our one night post cruise but tried somewhere else Campo De Fiori which was not the best choice, especially price wise). I look at all reviews on Trip Advisor and so far 'touch wood' we haven't gone far wrong. AIPORT TRANSFER - 4 euro each on the Terravision bus to Rome Termini - very easy - had to wait in a queue for 15 minutes. Tickets available inside airport at the Terravision desk. Should you arrive at the other airport in Rome then there is a train to the termini. TERMINI - This hotel is directly over the road from the station. We walked with the cases no problem. Couldn't believe how good this was located. TRAIN TICKETS TO PORT - we purchased these the day before travel to the port from the machine at the station 4.50 euro each. Just press 'english' on the machine and you are away. Very easy. There are trains every hour. There is a 10 minute walk to the port from the station not worth getting a taxi as they are a rip off. HOP ON/OFF BUS - These tickets are at the station along with the bus right outside this hotel 16 euro each. This stops at every attraction. HOTEL - Free breakfast - good air conditioning (wasn't good in the more expensive hotel we booked for the last night - don't book a hotel without air conditioning in the summer months). Room was small (other hotel was even smaller) but very nice, very clean. Also check voucher codes on google as I got 10% off through hotels.com with a promo code. The sign on the hotel reads 'Mediterraneao' not the full title. We walked past it at first.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent but aging”
Reviews.Author: garygraphy
Reviews.Content: Nothing to really brag about, its really a no frills hotel. The furnishings are dated. But still decent for the price. It's not bad really, just a place to sleep after a day's out. Location is very good, right outside of Termini. This is probably the best quality of the hotel. Service is so-so - they weren't particularly friendly, just typical of Rome service standards.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive marble lobby, good location just off Via Cavour and close to Termini - blah rooms.”
Reviews.Author: lisampls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterraneo for 3 nights at the start of a 10-day Collette Vacations tour. So obviously, the hotel was booked via Collette, not us. I believe they have a contract with the parent company - we also stayed at the Grand Hotel Palentino at the end of our trip (same company) - which I liked much better. Because we were in a group of about 40 people, our check in was with our group leader, not the front desk, so I can't say anything about that. The location is great - just a block from the Termini station and on Via Cavour. Easy walking distance to several sights and there are lots of restaurant options close by. Oh, and I have to say that while other reviewers said there were "shady" people hanging around the hotel - we never encountered anyone even close to "shady." Let's start with the lobby. Very impressive! Lots and lots of marble...and a very large sitting area with chairs and couches. There is also a bar on this level (never got anything there) and the breakfast area (I'll get back to that.) Our room was 403 and all I can say is "blah." While they were clean and well maintained, they just didn't have any life or personality to them. The best part was the bathroom...which looked to be newly remodeled. It was very nice - but a shame they haven't put any effort into updating the sleeping area. We had a "king" bed - so two beds pushed together - and it was hard. I thought it was terrible, my boyfriend thought it was fine. Linens were a tad scratchy to me. There was about three feet on each side of the bed and I'd say about 5 feet at the end of the bed. There are, 2 nightstands and a desk and chair - as well as a built-in closet in the room. I took a few pics with my phone, so they aren't that great, but I'll include them. I went down to see my mom's single room and yowza....that was SMALL!! A postage stamp may be a little big bigger than those rooms! Other than the grand lobby and the updated bathroom, they have updated the staircases - YES, the staircases....with this lovely tile. Not sure why money was spent there and not in the rooms, but it does make the time you're going down the steps more enjoyable (with sarcasm.) The breakfast room was an okay size, but was always very full. Options were the usual...lots of breads, pastries and cereals, coffee and juices, meats and cheeses, as well as eggs and bacon for the hot option. The staff was kind enough to get me a to-go box one morning when I was running late and had to catch my bus. They let me take a few croissants with me, which I thought was really nice. One of the best features of this hotel is the lovely rooftop bar/restaurant. We didn't eat up there (others in the group did and said it was good) but we did go up and have a drink and take some photos. Though we didn't have a problem with this, several people in our group said that they called the front desk (or stopped by) and requested a wake-up call. Many didn't receive them and one said it came an hour later than they requested. So beware.... Overall, if you're looking for a hotel close to the Termini and within reasonable walking distance to sights....this is a good option. Just know that the rooms are going to be basic, but clean, so if you want fancy - head to the lobby or the staircase! :-)

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Michel99
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room but when I asked for a high floor they gave me a double on a high floor. Service is ok and the cleqning is like often in Italy award winning!! Very clean. It was for the first time in my life I was not shocked by the minibar prices. very reasonable! The breakfast was ok and is always included. The hotel next door belongs to the same company and uses the same breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mediterraneo, opposite Termini Station, was wonderful in every way.”
Reviews.Author: jollygood08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is refined, has outstatnding staff, large rooms, a vast and fine breakfast, is clean and wonderfully situated. The concierge staff goes far beyond expections. We loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: jtaylor6
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. It is in dire need of remodeling. The furniture was old and worn, the beds were hard, the lighting was bad, etc. My bad experience began from check-in because the man behind the desk was incredibly rude, and then he placed me in a room the size of a shoebox. The room was literally a janitor's closet. I requested a move from another person behind the desk and was moved to a better room which was a superior double. There was more space but the decor and furniture was still very old and in need of an upgrade. The walls in the hotel are paper thin as well. I could hear the people next to me talking and above me using the restroom. The staff here are not friendly and their concierge is particularly nasty. Do not approach him with questions. The restaurant in this hotel is particularly gross as well. Eat elsewhere. The only positive things about this place are the great location and breakfast. Would never recommend and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel,shame about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kevinwine69
Reviews.Content: stayed recently with friends for 3 day trip.first time in rome and picked this hotel for it's location as it's 3 mins walk from the Termini where,if you get a budget flight,the terravision bus will drop you off.The hotel is very reminiscent of a 50's italian film.classic look and feel to it,the superior room was great,very spacious and huge bathroom,both were spotless,nice touches like robes etc,,and for people who enjoy a wee smoke,you can light up as and when you desire in your room.the bar is great,it's very retro with barstaff wearing the 50's look white jackets and the cocktails that match,nice roof terrace toobut drinks are very exspensive,breakfast not too great avoid the bacon and eggs it's vile(powdered egg,like baby sick!!) great coffee and pastries though.overall would stay here again no problem,dont expect too warm a welcome from reception staff,though i think that's pretty standard in general in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Rooms good quality”
Reviews.Author: richa678
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated at a good location right opposite Termini. Its easy to locate. We stayed here for 3 nights and found it at a good location to explore rome. Its very close to Colloseum. Infact we walked there every day and ofcourse being close to termini we took the subway to everywher else in rome which made it easy to travel. Ofcourse rome underground is not the best in terms of cleanliness and is very crowded in peak time but its ease of travel is very high. The hotel has nice rooms. The reception is ok they give directions and help you out with maps etc when you need it but not very pleasant and forthcoming when you compare with similar class of hotel around the world. The rooftop restautant is excellent and they even customised our meal and prepared excellent stuff. Its a nice atmosphere and a lovely view. The lobby is nice and you can see feel the cosiness as soon as you step in. The breakfast was excellent i think one of the best i had in the entire trip of italy. Its a good choice of breads, juices and has a good variety. Overall our experience at hotel was good and would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AssiaMoscow
Reviews.Content: The building is quite dark, but generally hotel - really good, solid "quartet", with invisible staff, large rooms and abundant American breakfast. I was particularly pleased with bathroom, consisting of 2 separate rooms and their size, and the presence of shower cubicles and baths, and constantly updated set of toiletries. he only thing anywhere in the room, we did not find a radiator, or even a heated towel rail. Apparently, Rome in Italy is already equal to the southern city, where the battery is not in nature. The furniture in the hotel, of course, too old, but in good condition and not a cheap initially, so is still quite suitable for a comfortable rest. Amenities - free safety box and central air conditioning. Hotels booked through hrs.de, without prepayment, the price of rooms DBL + Exbed -140 euros, from 5 nights, one was a gift, so that the result in general is cheap ..We also liked the location of the hotel - everything is convenient and close to everything: the transfer to Termini is not worth any effort to get to the airport is very convenient (for half an hour on the Leonardo Express) to the Coliseum on foot - for about 20 minutes to Plaza de España - 25 minutes, immediately next stop Open 100 and the metro, a lot of pretty decent trattoria nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - but hotel photos slightly misleading!”
Reviews.Author: robert28
Reviews.Content: Have just spent four days at this hotel and on the whole very pleased with it. Unlike previous reviews we have read, we found the hotel staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful. We arrived at the hotel at 11.30am and were able to check in straightaway. There was a very good choice at breakfast (although the only hot foods were scrambled eggs and bacon). The hotel was well located for the Termini but quite a long walk to the major sights. However, the Metro was very convenient for travelling to the Vatican (only 1 Euro each way). The only slight complaint we had was that our room looked nothing like the bedroom photos shown on Hotels.com (and I think the hotel's own website). The room was quite basic and although advertised as having a combined shower/tub, we only had a shower. Tea/coffee making facilities would also have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant staff at the reception.”
Reviews.Author: Brunch4two
Reviews.Content: When we check in, the reception apparently did not get our booking . Weird, as we receive their confirmation. To make a long story short, we have encountered a not so helpful staff, A certain lack of professionalism, a bit fed up with the chinese tourists ? This is the impression that we got. Pity as the hotel is well situated , 5 mns from bus and station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and the service”
Reviews.Author: PaSunlover
Reviews.Content: The room was fabulous - spacious, clean with a huge bathroom with the extra amenities like robes, slippers etc that make a hotel special. The staff was always helpful with making recommendations, reservations and calling for confirmations. Breakfast was more than adequate. The location was convenient for us since we came into Rome by train and it is just a short walk from the station but it is a good walk from any of the other major attractions. We walked to most of all of them and it is do- able but be prepared to hike...an hour to the Vatican as an estimate. Some complained about the noise but we were up on the 5th floor and didn't really notice it any more than any other busy city. Definitely would recommend this hotel to others. Take a minute it visit the garden restaurant on the rooftop for the view if not for the food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: herculesgal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Mediterraneo in Rome but it was noisy in the mornings during rush hour. You can't beat the location though. It's a block from Termini station which is what we wanted so we could get to other cities by train easily. It is also pretty close to the major attractions. We had a really nice, spacious room, nice bathroom with a bathtub, almost the size of an American size hotel room. Great view of the city. It also has a great garden restaurant on the 10th floor with views of the city while you dine. It was cold while we were there so we only stopped by to check it out so I don't know if the food is good. The staff was not the friendliest but they helped somewhat when we asked questions. The maid in our floor was really nice though. There are a lot of other hotels around so if you don't need to worry about being close to the station, find a quieter area of Rome to stay in. The breakfast was mediocre at best so we skipped it a couple of days. We were there for 5 nights. I would recommend the hotel to others but warned them that it's noisy in the mornings since it's on a main street.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: StaceyMcC
Reviews.Content: As American's living in England, we found this hotel to be of good value for the money. Often European hotel rooms are smaller and don't offer as many in room amenities unless it's expensively priced. However the Hotel Mediterraneo offered a large room including a mini-bar/fridge, free bottle of water, biscuits, shampoo, body lotion, etc. The location is very convenient being near the metro station and very walkable to many sites. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. Our only complaints were that the room was a bit noisy as we could hear the elevator 'ding' every time it came to the floor we were on and the noise from outside, but it wouldn't be enough for me to not recommend the hotel. Also on a Saturday night the terrace restaurant/bar was unavailable as there was a private event AND the bar downstairs was closed at 9:30 p.m. Was a bit disappointed as we would have liked to get a nightcap drink on a Saturday night. Overall though, very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ozjamboree
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in September at the beginning of a Trafalgar tour. The hotel was comfortable although the staff were not friendly and obliging at times. The room was average and there was some noise from the wooden floor above. The location is great with the Termini railway station a couple of hundred metres away.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great-Rome was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: greeneyedtraveler77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. The help at the desk was great. It was in walking distance to many of the sights of Rome, but close to the bus. It was also walking distance from the train, which you can take from the airport, and to many destinations in Italy. The best way to see Rome is on foot, but be careful. The streets are uneven. If you go take time to just sit at any little cafe and enjoy a glass of wine, and watch the world go by. Also, don't miss the gelato-there is nothing like it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jaxxmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mediterraneo the end of August. We were greeted with a warm smile upon arrival at the front desk and were given a beautiful room on the 9th floor. We really enjoyed being able to open our window and see St. Peter's Basilica and the rest of the city sites. Also when we were checking in, the receptionist gave us a card for 2 free drinks on the Garden Rooftop terrace our first day. It was such a pleasant gesture and we used it that night. The front desk was always helpful in answering questions we had. The breakfeast buffet was very nice and probably the nicest we had on our entire trip traveling through Italy. Great location - 2 blocks from the termini train station and metro. Made it really easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: ““nice, clean rooms- pleasant stay””
Reviews.Author: DaveTJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in july. We had a pleasant stay. The hotel is located within a few minutes walk from the termini station and about 15 minutes walk to the colloseum and trevi fountain. Most places of interest are within walking distance as long as you are prepared to walk on average of 25 minutes to get there. Rooms are reasonably sized and clean with a flat screen tv. We had a classic room on the 8th floor and to be fair it was slightly nicer than the pictures up on tripadvisor. Breakfast had plenty of variety and gave us a great start to the day. The only negative I have about the hotel is the service we received from the reception staff. Even though it was functional we didn’t feel that they were as welcoming as we have experienced at other hotels in Europe. However we got a good deal with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: h360906
Reviews.Content: You felt welcomed from the moment you walk through the doors you are met by a reception desk thatis very caring and polite. The staff was extremley friendly. They were very informative and made reservations easily. This is a 4 Star hotel with the feel of a 5 Stars. They were able to answer all your questions. The weekend front desk staff were amazing. The Roof Garden Restaurant had a teriffic view & food exceptional the price was comparable to other restaurants. The wait staff in the restaurant could not do enough for you they too were able to give you suggestions of touring. The location was great close to tranportation and made touring easier. We would definitely return. Thanks Mediterraneo....Mary Ann

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have wanted better”
Reviews.Author: caykon
Reviews.Content: We got the train from the airport as we knew the hotel was near to the train station. On arriving we thought we had the wrong hotel as it looked too smart! The reception staff were very friendly and a porter helped us with our baggage and explained how to work the door keycard and how it also worked the power in the room. The room was very plesant and clean. It had a safe to leave your valubles in which was a big help. Air conditioning which you could adjust to suit you. The shower was lovely and always hot water available. There was a mini bar in the room. We didnt use anything from this as it was quite pricey, but put our own drinks in the fridge, which we brought very cheaply from a convieinience store along the street. The breakfast was great. Loads to choose from and very tasty. We walked everywhere from the hotel, most was within a reasonable distance and you didnt feel like you were walking for agaes as you see so much along the way. We even walked to the vatican! The buses and metro are literally out the door and across the road for those who don't want to walk. We checked out on a monday and our flight home was not until 9pm. the hotel looked after our luggage for the day so we could spend the day sight seeing. They didn't charge extra for this. On a couple of accasions after a long day of trekking round Rome we didn't feel like eating out so got Pizza and wine from a very tasty takeaway and ate it in our room. The hotel staff didnt object to us taking this to our room. Really couldnt fault the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: negranelly
Reviews.Content: The most memorable aspect of out stay at the hotel is by far the service we received. We were originally given a smoking room and being that neither my husband nor I are smokers we requested a non-smoking room. The front desk very kindly accommodated our request. We found the temperature in the room to be hot and the room just had an overall dark feel. The hotel as a whole has an old feel to it, almost antique. The location wasn't great, but it wasn't bad. Its located in a high traffic area, it can get a bit loud at night from the late owls passing by. Its also quite a distance from Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sloping_fungus
Reviews.Content: Styed in the Mediterraneo on a surprise trip to Rome. Was delighted with the hotel. Located 2 blocks from the train station (Termini) it was handy when we got off the plane to get the train directly into the city centre. The hotel was lovely with 10 floors, the 10th with a roof terrace/bar which terrific views of the city, well worth a look even if your not staying there! The room had twin beds even though a double was booked, easily pushed together! Room was quiet spacious. The only real bad side was that the safe was a bit didgy and took a lot of tries to get finally locked. The bathroom was spacious amd light.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JenaC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice this June, for 2 nights at a time. The rooms vary considerably in size - on our second stay we requested a move, as our room reeked of smoke and the floors were uneven and creaked loudly. They gave us a choice of alternatives, so we saw the variations in size. We ended up with an excellent room - very spacious and with a lovely outlook. Most rooms are quiet due to the double-hung windows, although one of our group found themselves over a loading bay, which was unpleasant. On our second stay a gay rights parade, complete with 100+ decibel bands, took place right under our window - after we were tired of watching we discovered how effective the silencing was! We found the front desk very efficient and pleasant, and the concierge helpful (our taxis and airport limousine arrived promptly). The breakfast buffet was excellent. Yes, the lifts are old, but we seldom had to wait long. We loved the rooftop bar/restaurant - nobody minded us wandering around gawping at the views! Great for a late night coffee. It is not a cheap hotel, but we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, clean, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: jenVirginia
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in May. The room was spacious, clean, and the staff very helpful for tips on resturaunts etc. The location was convenient to the termi and transportation if wanted, however we walked to all sights with the exception of the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms pretty dated”
Reviews.Author: Jordan52777
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great---right next to Termini Station, the subway, and buses. The outside of the hotel looks relatively modern, but inside it's a blast from the past. The elevators are small and slow, and the rooms are, well... old. The green curtains, faded wood floors, and even the artwork seem to have been there for quite a while. The pillows were noticeably uncomfortable. On the plus side, the staff were very courteous, moreso than other places we stayed in Italy, and the breakfast buffet was very good. If you do stay here, try the Nueva Stella Trattoria around the corner for dinner -- it's excellent and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but know the taxi fare”
Reviews.Author: rlveld
Reviews.Content: Hotel overall is very nice. Probably 3.5 stars on a US scale. Great breakfast buffet. Beautiful lobby. Our triple room was large, with a large bathroom. The fixed shower head was mounted at an appropriate height for dwarfs, though. The room does not seem to be dusted very often. There was a large amount of dust everywhere. Same for vacuuming under the bed. Location right next to the Termini railway/Metro/bus station is very convenient. Safe area with plenty of affordable restaurants in the side streets around the hotel. Beware of the taxi fare from/to Ciampino airport: this amounts to a fixed $30 for any destination inside the old city walls (is written into City law and can be found on the sheets on the back of the seats in the taxi). For Da Vinci airport it is $40. When we took the cab, the driver charged us $30 to the old city wall, and then turned on the meter for another $14 more. On the way back, we had an honest taxi driver who explained the system. Overall not a big deal, but being taken advantage of as a visitor just torques me off. Shame on dishonest taxi drivers. Otherwise, we had a wonderful stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KnootS
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent location, friendly staff, very clean rooms. We would definately stay at this hotel again. However the restaurant in the 10th floor is ordinary and too expensive, and we experienced the internet connection to be almost non-excisting and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Chriswarwick
Reviews.Content: Had a good holiday, Hotel is just 3 minutes walk from the termini, which is the main train / bus station. Great when you are carrying luggage. It is easy to get around the whole city from there. Our room was large and very clean , loads of places to eat in the area, which gives you the option to eat in or out on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Classical Roman hotel, well situated to transport hub (coach/train/metro) and for exploring the city itself.”
Reviews.Author: SilverBuzz
Reviews.Content: Despite the size of our party, we were allocated five rooms all on the eigth floor, far enough away from what is a very busy main street into the central transport hub that is Terminus rail/metro, coach and bus stations. We arrived as part of a larger group of 30+ and our courier had already made the necessary arrangements for key collection, so it is not practical to say how Reception would have managed our check-in. However, check-out was done individually and this was polite, quick and efficient. Our stay included breakfast which was comprehensive and varied to suit most tastes, from juices, cereals, croissants, various bread and rolls plus condiments, through to cooked meats and cheeses, to bacon & scrambled eggs, fruit or yoghurt. Less satisfactory was the single coffee dispensing machine which produced excellent but slow results - there was invariably a queue for this and I recall from a visit two years ago, that the staff then would walk the room with coffee and tea pots, which was far more efficient. On a note of caution, the hotel is not very "access all areas" i.e. for those in a wheelchair or with a walking disability: there are lifts to all floors - including the roof terrace and restaurant - but the ground floor foyer facilities (breakfast room, bar, seating areas) are all accessed by a short flight of stairs opposite reception. The ensuite bedroom was excellent, well cleaned on arrival and maintained daily throughout our stay. It was good to have plenty of storage space with a wardrobe and drawers, bedside table, writing desk, plus dressing table, tv, coffee table and chairs. The bathroom was on the small side but adequate. The air-con appeared to be set to its winter function of heating only, rather than cooling, so it was Plan B (opening the window) but I guess that on the lower floors this option would be less suitable, due to traffic and street noise. I would also recommend a room above numbers -01 to -10, as these are nearest the elevators and friends found the incessant "bong" of their arrival wearisome, despite the double-doors that are fitted to the bedrooms. By contrast, further along the corridor in the rooms numbered from -11 upwards, I was not disturbed by this noise. The staff whom I encountered during my stay all appeared to be friendly and helpful, from the maid to the bar waiters and breakfast room waitresses, dealing promptly with our requests and fully meeting our needs. Overall, the Mediterraneo proved a very satisfactory and convenient hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Betttyblue
Reviews.Content: I was here with my mother and sister August 2007. It was a nice art deco hotel with a great location and friendly staff. Close to the central station so that you can just cross the street with your luggage and you're there.. And a nice point of departure for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent high-class hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Krakus
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel which I would highly recommend. It’s within a very short walking distance of the rail and bus station, and also the subway, so the location is great for planning sightseeing trips. We booked a triple room and were automatically upgraded to a very spacious room on the ninth floor with a high ceiling. It was well decorated with a floor-to-ceiling mirror on one wall and nice finishes, and it had a very large bathroom. There view was very limited and the window shutters were tightly closed, but guests receive an invitation to enjoy a free glass of champagne at the rooftop patio restaurant which has a terrific view of Rome especially at sunset. Our only complaint is that we had the misfortune of being situated directly beneath this restaurant, so some shuffling noises kept us awake at night, and the air conditioning unit was a bit noisy, too. There was good variety in the breakfast, which included eggs, some meat and cheeses, as well as the standard pastries. Unfortunately, the hotel’s wireless Internet access is very expensive as it is provided by Swisscom and we could not justify using it to check just a few e-mails. There are not many restaurants located next to the hotel. There is a mall on the ground floor of the rail station in case any supplies are needed. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlmichelle4571
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy for our honeymoon and used Gate1travel to book all our accomodations. They had two choices for hotels in Rome, this hotel and another. The other had horrible reviews on tripadvisor, so we picked this hotel, despite rather negative reviews as well. I must say that the past reviews I read were wrong! This hotel was great. It was in a good location, within walking distance to the colosseum and right next to the train station and both major metro lines. Our room was on the 8th floor and was georgous. There was a ton of storage, a computer with internet ( you did have to pay to use it) a mini fridge, queen sized bed and a very large bathroom. Everything was clean and they even provided complimentary snacks, a bottle of water and teabags. I know we got a better room because the staff knew we were on our honeymoon, but I couldn't be happier with the service we received at this hotel. The only sad thing was that we had two french doors with balconies, only they had a metal covering 3/4 of the way down as a safety feature. The light still was able to shine through, but it is sad that they can no longer be used for what they were originally intended for. It would have been nice to cuddle on the balcony and enjoy the signts of Rome. Breakfast was included with our room and we were happy to see a nice spread of european breads, hard boiled eggs, cold cuts, fruit etc. They also had a very cool cappuccino machine. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we already know that if we return to Rome someday, we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vanta_8
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a good location . Is next to the train station which is very convenient if you travel by train . Rooms are large and comfortable (we had one double and one single room and even the single was spacious enought ) and so are the bathrooms . Our rooms were in the 5th floor and so we had some view to . The furnitures are ok The breakfast is very rich and you have a thousand things to choose to eat . There is also a coffee machine and so you can have free caputcino and espresso . Staff is very friendly and cooperative . We liked this hotel and if we ever visit Rome again we will consider staying here .

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close to the Main Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: Lasertrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for seven nights in September, 2008 to attend a meeting at the Fiero Roma Convention Center near Rome Airport. The Mediterraneo is just 1.5 blocks from the main Metro station (called Termini) where one can catch both Metro lines (they cross here) and a taxi at the taxi stand. The neighborhood was fine right up until I got back to my room each night at 11 PM - not crowded late at night but it always appeared perfectly safe. The hotel room for two people was larger than many European hotels that I have stayed in, with a double bed, a couple of large chairs and a desk. The bedspread was a classic. I was impressed that the room was always kept very clean. My room on the eighth floor had nice clean polished hardwood floors. The bathroom was fine with a well functioning shower. The room came with a very good buffet breakfast in the back of the lobby level. It included a Cappuccino machine and fresh Italian bread plus the usual basic foods, such as scrambled eggs, bacon, hard boiled eggs, cheeses, deli meats, great fresh fruit, and juice. There is a rooftop restaurant with a live singer in the evening. The restaurant has a nice view. I ordered plain food not on the menu and it tasted pretty plain. Although the lobby seemed a bit old and run down, the rooms were recently updated - dark in color, with the necessary features, including modern air conditioning which could get down to 69 degrees. Efficient wireless internet is available, but expensive. The room contained a small safe. It was great that I had a refrigerator in the room. The television set had only a single English station - CNN - but many stations in other languages. The only definite minus was the long wait each time we asked the bell staff to hail a taxi. After a few days we realized it was faster to walk to the Metro station and get one in the taxi line. The front desk staff were slow but pleasant. The check in process seemed old fashioned but in a good way. Shopping around the hotel was OK, but not great. There were not many elegant stores nearby. If you walk out the door and go about four blocks to the right, you will see Buffetti on the other side of the street, which is a stylish office supply store with nice Italian leather office materials. Ask the staff for directions to the nearest large grocery store, which is about six blocks away and is a completely stocked store in the basement of an office building. The hotel is great for Metro travel but if you want to hang out in the charming historic district, then expect to walk about 30 minutes or take a taxi each time you want to get there. The Rome Metros are very easy to navigate and you can go from the main station near the hotel to the Coliseum or to the Spanish Steps or the Vatican by Metro. This is a very nice hotel and I would probably stay here again because of its central location near the main Metro station and because it has everything most travelers need, including a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: cpyoon
Reviews.Content: We were warned that European hotels aren't quite the same as those in North America. None the less, we found the reviews on this hotel helpful and quite enjoyed the place. The lady at the counter initially wasn't too friendly but after being really nice and smiling to her, she was fine. Bad day? I was happy that they let us check in 2-3 hours early. The lobby is very clean, pretty big and definitely has a "grand" feel. The room was a lot more spacious than we though it'd be given what people say about European hotel rooms. Bathroom was renovated as it looked pretty new. Room was very clean as well. After getting off the elevator, there was a smell of cigarettes but they don't have a no smoking policy over there. The room itself was fine and did not smell. We had room 703. You'd hear the early morning traffic and there was even some construction but the noise wasn't that bad. We got up relatively early to go see the sights anyways. Location was great with some cafe's and restaurants around the corner or further down the street. Less than 5 min. walk to the main "Termini" where there's train, bus and subway. It was so convenient to get to the various sights. Some within walking distance of the hotel as well. The area was very safe as well. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay and we felt it was a very good hotel. Although ranked as 3 star (European ranking), we thought it was quite good. Much better than the 4 star one that we stayed in one night (Airport Palace Hotel). We got a pretty good deal through www.hotels.ca and would definitely stay here again. Hope you find the photos helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sammy10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July/08. The location was excellent!!. There is a coffee shop on the same side of the hotel not even a block away where you have the option of sitting outdoors and they serve excellent coffee and drinks. Coffee and drinks might be more expensive if you want the option of sitting down so please ask. We were never charged extra for sitting down. The Termini Station is right across the street where you can purchase sandwiches and drinks at a very reasonable price. There is even a McDonald's and a supermarket where you can purchase your drinks. Just remove the beverages in the mini bar and replace it with your own drinks. The On and Off Bus is also located right across the street from the Termini Station. There are numerous restaurants in the area that you can dine and the area was very safe to walk in the evenings. The 10th Open Bar is an excellent location for the evening where there is live music playing and you have an excellent view of the city. The only downfall is that there was no pool and if you are travelling with children after a long day a pool to cool off would of been enjoyable. I would stay at this hotel again due to the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Superdanne
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three night stay at the Mediterraneo... You can't get a better location, it's right across the street from the Termini station! When arriving to Rome we even walked past it because I thought it would be further down the street... It's very convinient to reach all the famous sites, no matter if you walk or go by bus or metro.
