The room was very nice and clean although the furniture wasn't modern, but you wouldn't expect it either considering the classic 'theme' of the hotel. The room was equipped with a minibar/fridge, tv, hair dryer, good AC (highly needed), safe and a great shower. The bed was on the hard side but that's no problem for me. The complimentary breakfast was really good with everything we needed and they even had a highest standard coffee maker so you can get a freshly brewed espresso or cappucino. There are also some nice restaurants and shops in the near vicinity. We also got a bargain price, paying only 80 euro/night for a double room. All in all, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlsart
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel. The roof top restaurant was beautiful with amazing views. The rooms were clean with hardwood floors and marble. It had a full bathtub, great after walking all over Rome. We only had two days and the staff was very helpful in their advice for dining, the tips on the fastest ways to Rome attractions and general information. It was right next to the train station and easy to navigate from. The breakfast buffet was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base to Explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: LGBOC
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel, after booking it on the internet for a reasonable rate. We were staying in Rome for 2 days and travelling down the coast so wanted a base close o Termini Station (the main station in Rome). This hotel is only across the street from it, less than 5 minutes walk. We walked to most of the main attractions from the hotel. Aside from location, the hotel itself was excellent - helpful staff, clean fresh rooms. The roof top terrace has lovely views over the city - when we were there a glass of champagne was one of the cheapest drinks on the menu which was a nice way to start the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TEW49ers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to start our honeymoon because it was modern and close to the Termini train station, where we came in from the airport. The Metro stop is only one short block away, with great access to city sights. We also walked back to the hotel both nights after Metro was closed. Very good selection at the breakfast buffet, incl. scrambled eggs, fruit, pastries, meats, cappuccino machine, etc. The bedroom and bathroom had everything we could need. Many toiletry samples, etc. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellisd88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterraneo hotel from 24th March to the 27th March for a short break in Rome. After flying into to Rome and getting a connecting train to the Termini station we were please to find the hotel was only a few hundred metres away. Far enough away so the station is out of sight but close enough so that you can walk it. We were checked in with no issues and placed on the 9th floor in Room 922 which was by my standards a very large european room with a brand new en-suite fitted. The view we had over Rome was fabulous! We did all the major sights and did two tours through Angel tours which were very good and enabled us to miss massive queues at both the Vatican and the Colosseum. We also walked pretty much everywhere using the metro now and then but we found the hotel was within walking distance from everything but we loved walking down smaller roads and through less well known piazza's. The only point to be wary of in Rome is the cost. Everything is outrageously expensive, especially food which seemed to be even dearer than London where I am from. The hotel were very helpful in offering us advice on where to go for drinks and our room was cleaned every day to a good standard. We ate in the hotel on our first night and the food was excellent although pricey but this was the same everywhere. Breakfast in the mornings is really nice and they do a nice selection of meats and scrambled eggs. Please do not hesitate to book here if you are booking a short trip to Rome. I do not understand why anyone would give a bad review here??

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Silver-Elite
Reviews.Content: Just one block from Terminii Train station, and also the Metro subway station makes getting around a breeze. Direct airport train makes arrival/departure stress free. (11Euro p/p, one way) Cafes, pizza and restaurants all close by. Hotel has breakfast buffet included in rate-a decent selection of hot/cold offerings, including a latte/espresso/cappacino machine. Rooms were quite large for a European hotel and quite. Bar is pricey-but so are most in Rome. Hotel desk will exchange dollars for Euros, gave us a good rate at the time. Desk staff all spoke English and were always helpful, including giving us large street maps. Given the other hotels I researched, I was very pleased considering you can pay a lot more in this city. Small workout room downstairs, but with all the walking for sightseeing-you won't need it! When we return, will stay here again, no question...

Reviews.Title: “Certainly NOT a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel34
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a romantic break in Rome which included the experience of staying at the Bettojja Hotel Meditteraneo. The hotel was listed as a 4 Star and was far from it. I had researched for the perfect hotel as it was our first romantic weekend away and I was really dissapointed. The roof top area was closed which was unfortunate especially as one of the plus's of the hotel was roof top views. The only view from the hotel was another hotel with endless noise at all hours. Work men early from 7am. Hotel staff in the bar area were exceptionally helpfull but for 20 euros per cocktail they would be gracious and helpfull. Front desk staff were miserable and very unhelpful. When we requested a good resturant to visit we were advised of the hotel resturant and none others were known. Our room was old and in need of a good make over and some newer towels would've been great (and more than 2). An iron wouldve been great but we had to pay for our clothes to be ironed as this service wasnt complimetary. The only good point of this hotel was the location. It was in close proximity of the Station Termini (easy reach to all areas in Rome and to the airports). I had previously asked the hotel the easiest cost effective route to get to the hotel and the reply was to have a car for 47 Euros. It is actually 6 Euros to use the metro and 12 Euros to use a bus. The local transport is so easy to use and quick.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: lawchicago2850
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a very long flight from Chicago via London. I was tired , and cranky. Pleasantly suprised at the interior of hotel . Room was clean if a bit dowdy ,but the view was glorious ! Overlooked a beautiful piazza with fountain in the distance. The hotel staff was helpful if a bit stiff but overall ,with a very nice breakfast offering included in the room price with a good breakfast selection have no complaints at all . would stay at this hotel again and have recommened it to friends who have upcoming trips to Rome. great location near just about everything .

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: misslizzabeth
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3night stay at Bettoja Hotel Mediterraneo with my partner. This hotel is fabulous, I couldn't have asked for anything else. First impression as we walked into the hotel....wow! Reception- very helpful and always happy, all speak english. Room was a really good size, and the bathroom was immaculate...room service everyday. Minibar and toiletries- If you have forgotton anything essential don't worry, they have it all there. Resturant and bar on the roof top was amazing, great view and lovely food. Buffet breakfast- Great start to the day-Large breakfast room open from 6am-10.30am and LOADS to choose from. This hotel is close to everything- about a ten fifteen minute walk to the colliseum. Great resturants and bars close by. Right next to the bus station so easy to get to other places around the city. We walked in the day and took taxis at night. I couldn't reccomend this hotel anymore. We loved it and are defo going back there again. Hope this has helped

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Excellent rail connections”
Reviews.Author: Rob1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterraneo Hotel in Rome for 3 nights in a 9th floor room. The room was large for a city hotel room and was surprisingly quiet due to the good double glazing. The room was bright, clean but on the very warm side. The service from the hotel staff was excellent especially on the roof terrace. Some great views - not to be missed. Breakfast is a large buffet with plenty of choice. Both the Rome Coliseum and Forum are about 15 minutes walk away. The starting point of the Rome sightseeing bus is just outside the Termini. A good way to start a visit to Rome. The hotel is about 1-2 minutes walk from the Rome Termini and therefore ideal if arriving of dearting by rail. In addition, if flying into Rome Ciampino airport Terravsion run a shuttle coach to Rome Termini rail station therefore making this hotel an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel - excellent location for temini”
Reviews.Author: ArdMhacha
Reviews.Content: A good hotel but not a full 4 stars as it claims to be - plenty of extras in the form of toiletries, robe slippers in superior rooms but the rooms could be better in some cases , we had two rooms and one room was much larger than the other, also in our room beds were twins that were very small - I am 5 7 and my feet were over the end of the mattress. Break fast is ok - wide range but not enough staff and hot food holder does not close so food gets cold quickly. Prices in the bar very high whiskey costs 9 euro, bottles of beer 5 euro - no draft beer. Avoid the Washington bar/cafe - via vimnale, absolute rip off. To eat take bus 75 to trastevere - much cheaper and better quality food - Marios on via del moro is excellent. Also cafe on left side of esquilano square beside maria maggiore church, is good value - can't remember the name.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise at the Mediterraneo.”
Reviews.Author: Bosques
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mediterraneo for two nights at the end of August. Location is excellent, 1 minute walk from Termini, as I know what the area near Termini is like, I was a little concerned, but the area around the hotel is very safe and light. The outside of the hotel indicates that it is quite new, but the interior is delightfully antique. We were allocated a huge room on the 9th floor, very nice parquet floor, huge bathroom, digital air con control, PC and printer, new flat screen TV, amazing for the price considering how expensive Roma is! We were given complimentary drinks for the roof terrrace on our arrival and enjoyed them as the perfect start to the trip. The breakfast buffet is served in a wonderful large room, the breakfast itself was adequate. Ask for fresh coffee to ensure you don't get someone elses cold leftovers. Reading the earlier reviews, I waited for the scraping of tables from the said roof terrace, but we did not suffer any problems, but that is probably becuase we did not get back to the hotel till after the terrace had closed. I did hear some noise as we were checking out so I would not recommened the 9th floor for families or people who enjoy early nights. All in all a very nice hotel for the price I got on expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: logan33961
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a block away from the termini station. Very accomodating staffs, great breakfast. Room is a little bit out dated but did not mine cuz of the exhaustion. Very nice lobby and balcony! I would stay here again and would recommend to my family.

Reviews.Title: “Mediterraneo worked for us”
Reviews.Author: Italiafan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August and were very pleased with hotel. It is a long walk to the main sites but being so close to the trains and buses made this a very good location. We would stay again. Staff are helpful. Hotel is clean. Room was quite`large. Breakfast offers more than average for Italy but is only mediocre. Termini is not such a bad area. Beds are comfortable - nice linen, awful pillows (hard and lumpy). Roof restaurant is a lovely place to drink and watch sun set over Rome. We did a train trip to Ostia Antica and then beach. This was a really good day out. Hotel is a gem if you want to be close to transport links. Buy the 11 Euro 3 day card.

Reviews.Title: “4* near Termini”
Reviews.Author: DonnaCH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a block away from both Rome's bus station and the railway/subway station. The neighborhood was clean and away from some of the confusion which normally surrounds such places. Rooms were very clean and provided a mini bar as well as a hair dryer. There was bath gel/shampoo but no cream rinse. What they did provide was in very small quantities, so bringing your own items along might be a good idea. I was the tour escort for a group which, as it turned out, had huge differences in the furnishings and quality of the rooms. The hotel is in the process of renovating, so if you want a nicer room, you should mention this up front. Breakfast was a buffet of breads, yogurt, eggs, cold ham and cheese, tomatoes, and fruit. Coffee, tea, and juice were available as well. I had my wallet stolen in the breakfast room by a man dressed in a dark suit, seated by himself at an adjacent table, and drinking only a cup of coffee. This appears to be a huge problem all over Italy, so be conscious of who is near you at all times. Unforunately, the hotel does not require proof that you are booked there to be admitted to the breakfast room. These professional thieves can walk right in off the street and case a room without anyone being aware. The front desk staff was helpful, and in this case, helped me contact credit card companies to cancel my cards. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling alone or with a group. The location is convenient and there are several decent cafes/restaurants nearby. The 10th floor has a nice little restaurant and terrasse with a lovely view over Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: IKDR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as it was where the conference organisers had arranged the stay. The rate was €170 for a double (single occupancy) - when my husband joined me it was €200 a night. GOOD THINGS The location was handy enough - especially if you got the train into town. Breakfast was included - fairly unusual for a Rome hotel - it was an average European buffet, but acceptable enough. The roof top bar, whilst a little pricey, was a lovely place to chill out in the evening, and had lovely views across Rome. BAD THINGS The room was very small and cramped. The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows were like little flat rocks. The soundproofing between rooms is awful. The bloke next door came in late and I was woken by him singing at 2am! All in all it was an average stay. However, I wouldn't pick this hotel if I had been paying for it myself. Most of the other guests appeared to be part of large charter groups - 'Europe in a week' type of stay - which isn't conducive to a quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: pkrockit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Polite, friendly staff, decent rooms and only one block from the train station and the Metro. Close to the opera, national museum and Diocletian Baths. Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Double-paned windows keep the rooms quiet. Rooftop restaurant has a great view ... one of the highest points in all of Rome ... you can see all the way to the Vatican. The first two nights we stayed on the top (9th) floor underneath the restaurant, and the noise from scraping chairs and footsteps on the bare floor was like a Chinese water torture, but when we complained, they immediatley moved us down two floors and all was well. Breakfast was reasonably good. Some rooms have computers with printer and internet access, although the access rate is fairly expensive. The computer in a quiet corner of the lobby takes credit cards and charges a more reasonable per-minute rate. I'd certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but...”
Reviews.Author: PhilThePhotographer
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this an Above Average rating because the staff was flawless and friendly. The hotel itself is average with lots of goods and groans to be mentioned or simply repeated from other's reviews below. Priced right at 160Euro for a Triple room. The rooms are dated but it was expected and is actually their intended design theme. Starting with GOOD: Staff pleasant and multilingual, location superb (minutes walk from main train depot area (Termini), 30 seconds of walking to nearest subway (Metro), internet and laundromat 1 blk away, grocery store in Termini lower level, cash exchange at front desk for fixed rate (probably still best from a Visa based ATM), tours depart from lobby (never used any though), decent breakfast with cereals, salad, fresh bread, scrambled eggs (European cold style), ham, yes - left over old coffee but cappucino available upon request as well as espresso (most people never realized it was available), cold cuts and cheeses, fresh fruit, mozz balls, etc...A great FREE start to your travel day. Several pastry shops in area where coffee and breakfast snack is available as an alternative. The room's have safes and stocked fridge but we took out their items and put in our own groceries and my sensitive films. Bathrooms nice with tub/shower and own hair dryer and soap/caps/shampoo/shoe shine. Nitpicks:Termini area is dirty and homeless sleep on sidewalk at night, pickpockets that aim for the elderly and unwary, traffic noise outside all windows until about 11pm and starting at 6am, room was deodorized to cover previous smokers before but was gone after a few hours and not an issue because no matter what you do you'll suck cigarette smoke before the day is over (I guarantee!) because almost everybody in Italy smokes for some reason, TV barely functional and only CNN was available in english. Walls are pretty thin but not in every room from what I gathered from cleaning staff -pretty much hit or miss on this one. We picked this for price and location convenience to Termini for access to Fiumicino. It's 10min from Colliseum by foot and about 1.5mi worst case to the furthest of all other sites which is good because subway (Metro) doesn't run through the city - only the buses and taxis do. Buses are your friend - learn about them before you go and expect heavy commuter crowds at 5pm. I shoot pictures day and night and never felt unsafe in the streets - even with homeless people around the Termini at 2am in the morning (keep in mind that if anybody should worry it should be me because I carry and use about $11K in professional gear). The lobby is beautiful and my daughter asked if we were in Bill Gate's hotel because it was very nice :o). Car rental companies inside Termini made easy access for us picking up and dropping off our rental. I wouldn't stay here if you are accustomed to paying $400-$500 nightly for a hotel or if you think a Motel 6 for $59 is too expensive because this isn't your style. It's more for everybody else in between and the prices for booking should be checked online and at the hotel for best rate. I would stay here again but others may opt for a location slightly closer to Vatican side of town if they don't like walking or public transportation. Contact me as needed with any questions - Regards, Phil.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for station, friendly staff - but hotel is tired.”
Reviews.Author: 5star~C.
Reviews.Content: Three nights stay at the Mediterraneo. Lovely public areas, all in superb art deco style, it's like time has stood still. Problem is, this is fine for the public areas, but our room felt like it needed a serious update/renovation. Room size was average. Room view of alley - hotel kitchen - lots of early morning deliveries and rubbish pick-up! VERY hard bed and pillows, although it didn't matter because we were tired each night by lots of sighseeing. Staff very helpful and friendly. Wonderful rooftop terrace! Convenient for Termini Station, but we would rather have been closer to the sights and more restaurants/cafes. Plan on a return to trip to Rome soon, but will look for different accomodation. My husband I I joke about it reminding us a little of the hotel in "The Shining"!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!! Location!!”
Reviews.Author: mcafe
Reviews.Content: Husband and I checked other 4 star hotels around the area and this hotel was cheapest and closest to the station. We just walked in to the hotel, but the hotel gave us a discounted rate without negotiation. It was better price than all other web-travel agency prices. I recommend to go to their own website to check the price. We paid 150 Euro for a double room (w/a king size bed) for all 5 days including Friday. Other 4 star hotels around the area priced 175 -220Euro/night Room was clean and comfortable with classic décor; the carpet was worn out thought. There is a minibar fridge that you can store a bigger size pet bottle drink. A big bathroom with nice shower, double sinks and stone finished wall and floor- felt like a 4 star hotel. Cons are thin walls and ceiling, hard bed and pillow, Breakfast coffee tasted bad. I think this hotel is not for the person seeks great interior and luxury but for the person who want to save money but still want to have all the amenity that make the stay comfortable. Most I liked about this hotel was the staff-I felt like I was watching an old European TV show-they are friendly but professional. We went checking other hotel but I felt most welcomed here even though it is big hotel. Finally, location was super convenient!! Roma city itself is very easy to walk everywhere, so, in the morning, start to walk from the hotel, and when you get tired of walking around, just step on to the bus or subway to go back to the hotel. I usually don't like getting on the bus in unfamiliar land because it is confusing about destination, but in this case I loved it because most buses go back to the central station, there are many bus stations through out the Roma city conveniently located around sightseeing area that is sometime located far from a subway station (ex, Pantheon) and the hotel was closest to the station. Also, you can enjoy the view while riding. Less walking distance compared to getting on the subway even thought the subway entrance is a block away. You will appreciate it after the long sightseeing walk. A Internet spot (1/2 hour is 1 Euro) was 1 block away, Snack stores were half block away. A supermarket is located in the central station, Also, public phone booth was located within the hotel on grand level so that you don't have to go outside to make cheap phone calls!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: DanT_GT
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Meditteraneo surprised me - I didn't expect it to be as nice as it was. We picked it due to its location - close to the Termini station. This was a BIG bonus, as it made getting around so much easier. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and spoke English very well. The rooms were very clean and bigger than I expected. We booked a "Double Room" and had plenty of space. The beds were a bit firm - but we still slept great. Probably due to running around Rome all day! I have no problem recommending this hotel and would easily stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, and what a view”
Reviews.Author: melkozek
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Rome at the Bettoja Hotel Mediterraneo and thoroughly enjoyed it. This is a moderate size hotel (150 or so rooms) located 1 block from the Teremini metro station, the main bus station and the main rail station in Rome. The area wasn't elegant, but we found it completely safe and very convenient for getting around Rome. Walk down the Via Cavour and you are at the Roman forum in about 15 minutes. The area has restaurants, pizzarias, a bakery, a small market and the national roman museum is around the corner. Our room (#816) was extremely clean, large, and had the only balcony in the hotel. Maid service was great. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. When we needed a wake-up call, it was on time. The hotel provided a large breakfast room with a good selection of items. Coffee, juice, salami, ham, eggs, cornflakes, toast, yogurt, etc. were available each day with prompt and friendly service from a large staff. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. I would rank it as a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomasitoAustralia
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our last 2 nights in Rome. We had been staying in 2 star hotels previously, but wanted a little more luxury for our final days. The hotel was in a great location for the bus and train as well as restaurants and shops. We were happy with our room (although the furnishings were a little dated), which included an LCD TV and a bathroom with a bath!! - something we hadn't come accross in previous Italian hotels. Like other travellers on TripAdvisor, we didnt eat at the hotel restaurant, as there were so many great restaurants close to us. We did have breakfast at the hotel daily, but found it lacking and really not on par with what we were getting from other 2 star hotels. Plus, during 'peak time' you had to hang around the tables waiting for other guests to leave. Also, I noticed that the breakfast staff didnt replace the tablecloths between guests and left the chairs covered in crumbs - something that was never an issue at other lower priced hotels. Overall, my husband and I were satisfied with the hotel, but did not feel that the hotel was worth the 260 euros we paid for the 2 nights. (But then again, we are from Australia where the accomodation is larger and cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Art Deco hotel close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: jenxox
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this beautiful hotel and I would recommend it as good value for money in a pretty good location. We had compared other hotels in the chain, Hotel Atlantico and Massimo something.... which it turned out where right next door and opposite the Mediterraneo. We booked through the hotels website last minute and got a room for 2 adults, 1ch for around £100 per night inc breakfast. I'm not big on continental breakfast but the service was good and there was plenty of coffee!! The room was quite spacious by European standards and they had added an extra bed for my little girl at no charge which was a nice extra. We flew with Easyjet to Ciampino and got the Terravision coach for EUR13 return pp to Termini. Via Cavour is just the other side of the station from where we got dropped off and the hotel is at the top of the road - we walked it with luggage and a 6yo in about 5 minutes - glad we didn't get a taxi as it really was only a street away. Being close to Termini was handy to get the Hop-on-hop-off Tour Bus to get an idea of what we wanted to see and where we were! Just at the end of Via Cavour, about a 20 minute stroll is the Colosseum. We got a taxi from the hotel to the Trevi Fountain for EUR5 and a taxi to the Spanish Steps which was EUR6 - just because we were being lazy - you could probably walk it in about 30 minutes. We ate in the hotel restaurant one evening and it was ok - not terribly expensive but none of us were overwhelmed by it. We finished most evenings in the hotel bar and the barman was very courteous and welcoming. All in all I thought it was a good choice of hotel and good value. I was looking for a hotel with a bit of character and I believe that's what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mediterraneo”
Reviews.Author: Topsail-Rachel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, large clean rooms, good quality linens and interesting decor. The art deco design is very Roman and well preserved. The staff at the front desk always spoke excellent English and were willing to indulge my poor Italian. They were very helpful and generous with their time and advice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very poor service”
Reviews.Author: SylviaMarks
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised by its location. We were shown to our room which was a nice size and clean if a little dated. On the first night we asked the concierge to book us a table at a nearby restaurant. As we were about to leave we luckily checked that this booking had been made to which we received the response that it was fully booked and they had not been able to make the reservation!! Thanks for letting us know!! We were then woken at 7am the next morning by workmen hammering away at the wall next to our room, when we complained about this to the reception they told us they were unaware of any work being carried out in the building but would try to find out and ask them to stop. The work stopped for precisely the time it took us to get back to sleep and then started again!! We then made another complaint and asked to be moved - they moved us to a room right next to the hotel lifts, at which point we decided to give up on sleeping and go to breakfast. The breakfast selection looked pretty standard for an Italian hotel but after piling some scrambled eggs onto the plate we found that it was cold and inedible. The next day we tried to order a snack from room service and were told that the only room service that was available was ham and cheese toasted sandwich - i asked for just cheese but apparently this was too much trouble. We said yes anyway and it took 50 minutes to be delivered to the room. We then asked for a taxi to take us to our reservations and were told it would be along in 20 minutes. We asked them to cancel this so we could make our own way as we were running slightly late for our dinner reservations and hailed a cab outside the hotel - we were then stopped form getting in the taxi as they would not cancel the taxi that would be along in 20 minutes!! I must stress that we LOVED ROME!!! It’s a fantastic city with so much to do and see (I have been 4 times now) and i would have no hesitation in going again however the hotel was appalling even by 2 star standards. I would recommend that people stay in the Sophitel or the Hotel Africa which gives much better service, better rooms and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near to most locations of interest”
Reviews.Author: Brinuk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from spending 5 days at this hotel. It's location is excellent. Near to the main train station for arrivals and departures from the airport (Buy a return ticket at the airport to save time). When you arrive on the Airport Express at Termini Station follow the exit signs to thje Metro and then choose the Cavour exit from there. The hotel is also within easy walking distance of all attractions (20 - 30 minutes) apart from the Vatican which is a simple metro train ride away. Queques to get into the Vatican were about one hour long. Queques to go up the dome about 1 hour long (Unless you really want to go up, don't bother, concentrate on the rest. Queques for the tombs of the Popes about 5 minutes) The hotel has a restaurant which looked good although we never ate there because if you come out of the hotel and turn right, on the next side street on the right there are some good and reasonable priced restaurants. One with good home made food is the trattatori straight across when you turn onto the side street. Family run. Good food, cheap and friendly. The hotel is quiet and clean with good sized rooms, ours looked as thought it had just been refurbished. The area near to Termini station (left out of the hotel) is not great at night but turning right out of the hotel takes you down Via Cavour and the area seemed safe with shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mediterraneo - wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: KarenDiane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 wonderful days in Rome the Spring of 2005 and the trip was made even more memorable by our stay at Hotel Mediterraneo! From the very first moment stepping into the beautiful lobby and being greeted by the wonderful staff made it a delight. The location is close to everything and centrally located. A breakfast buffet is included in the room rate and it is a great way to start your day, with variety and great taste. We are returning to Rome this Fall and have already booked our room at this elegant hotel which will feel like coming back home to the city eternal.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: theodoric
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 8th to 11th Aug. It is ideally located - minutes from metro station, bus and rail terminus. The vicinity is clean and safe. The room is satisafactorily equipped, although the beds are a bit narrow. Airconditioning is very satisfactory and services when averaged are good - excellent in its concierges especially Francesca, a pleasant, nice, helpful and knowledgeable lady but very poor in breakfast rooms! Service there is non-existent; maids gather only to chat and do scarcely raise a brow when customers enter. When we asked where we can sit they just beckon with their heads and murmured something, making sure that their conversations were not interrupted. It was curious that some male colleagues who dressed like their seniors did pass by but seemed to endorse their behaviour. A very rare scene indeed. Luckily the top floor restaurant services are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: Artsy3003
Reviews.Content: I also stayed on the first floor of this hotel and was very happy with it. The hotel was very standard, there are no irons and no alarm clocks, so FYI to get wrinkles out of clothes you must send them out to pay to get pressed. However with that said, I found the front desk, in particular the Concierge to be very helpful both when speaking English and Italian. Our safe in the room had gotten jammed and they were up to fix it wihin 10 minutes which was great. I stayed there three nights and it was clean and suitable for our stay. Its not exactly a luxury hotel, but for our purpose it was very clean, friendly, and nice!

Reviews.Title: “Cool reception, plumbing problems”
Reviews.Author: eleonoraditoledo
Reviews.Content: My Italian isn't great, but it's clear and understandable, but the front-desk clerks made insulting faces when I spoke to them in Italian. Only the porter who expected a tip for taking my bags to my room, smiled. The change in front-desk personnel over my two-night stay did not change in snobbery. My room on the first floor was definitely of the 1930s vintage that they described in their internet ads. This means it had not been updated since the 1930s. This means the sheets and bedding smelled old. This means I woke to a wet bathroom floor the next morning caused by several, steady drips from the bathroom ceiling (probably from the shower or toilet upstairs). It was totally gross and unacceptable. So I packed and asked for an adjustment in my rate and a change in rooms. The woman at the front desk was incredulous and said that she would have to send someone to confirm the problem, but that there would be no adjustment in my rate. When I pressed her for a different room, she gave me the key to the room next door immediately. My new room was a smoker's room (I'm a non-smoker), but the bathroom was dry and appeared to be of a more recent vintage, so I decided that living with the stale cigarette smell would be more prudent than throwing the dice again for another bathroom. The room quality was similar to a no-star hotel I once stayed at in rural China. This hotel really deserves the lowest rating if not for its very convenient location to Termini and the Metro and for the spectacular breakfast that it serves. There were eggs every morning (scrambled and hard-boiled), bacon, salami, cheeses, yogurt, croissants and rolls of all sorts, fresh fruit, juices, even salads. The wait staff was efficient, polite and appreciative of my requests in Italian. Romans make wonderful hot chocolate and the hot chocolate here was the best I've had anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on easter weekend. The location is simply superb, just a block away from Termini station and walking distance to Piazza Venezia, Colloseum, all main shopping areas. In fact, vatican area is also walkable if you like long walks. The staff was very friendly and helped us with all the information we wanted. Breakfast was pretty decent and filling. Regarding the room, we had room away from the main road, so no noise issues. Room was reasonably big and bathroom was pretty spacious as well. The room has an oldish feel to it in terms of furniture etc. Overll a very decent hotel and i will choose the same hotel without any hesitation whenever I am in Rome next.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Charm on Palatine”
Reviews.Author: redeco
Reviews.Content: The Mediterraneo was booked for our group of 30 as part of a tour package and frankly the reviews of the hotel on Trip Advisor made us a little nervous. From the moment we arrived in the splendid Art Deco lobby, we were pleasantly surprised. Rooms were well appointed, clean, and comfortable. Bathrooms not roomy, but spotless and there was plenty of hot water with good water pressure. Closets large and convenient and the flat screen TV represents the latest in technology. Breakfast excellent with lots of choices and the lobby bar charming and comfortable. From a tourist point of view, the location is excellent. The Forum and Coliseum is about a fifteen minute walk down the Palatine Hill and Santa Maria Maggiore and San Pietro in Vincolo can be visited on the way. The Fontana di Trevi is just a seven minute cab ride from the hotel that costs about 8 Euros. You can visit the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, and Piazza Navona on the same visit. The area around the hotel is honeycombed with wonderful trattorias and restaurants because of its proximity to the train station and I would recommend this hotel to any Rome traveler. It was easily the most exciting bit of old world color on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Suite 3 - Perfect for a family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom booked this hotel on venere.com before I read the negative reviews from tripadvisor, so I was quite worried when we arrived. We paid an average of 260 euros per night, and it was well worth it! We booked a triple, and my expectations were not high. However, we were quite pleased when we got off the elevator on the top floor and walked into our suite. There is a seperate living room, with a comfy couch and two wing chairs, a flat-screen tv, good lighting, a fridge, and french doors that open onto the terrace. The bedroom had two beds pushed together and then a seperate bed set up in the corner, a desk, another chair, tv, and a roomy closet where all of our luggage was kept. The sheets were gorgeous Italian linen and the beds were comfortable. A friend of mine stayed with us one night and slept on the couch, which was also decent. The bathroom is roomy, was spotlessly clean, well equipped with lots of towels, robes, and all of the extra toiletries, a jacuzzi tub, and a great shower with good water pressure and very hot water. My mom and aunt are used to traveling well and staying in classy places, and they were even impressed! Our terrace was HUGE! It formed a L-shape and was the entire length and width of our suite. There was a table where we popped some champagne and had snacks one afternoon with an incredible view of the city - it was really magnificent. The housekeeper was very helpful and always left us plenty of extra towels and anything we asked for. I've stayed in many places all over Europe, and considering the difference of customs with American/English breakfasts and European breakfasts, this buffet was very nice - plenty of fruit, juices, breads, croissants, cereals, sweet pastries, etc. The put a pot of coffee on your table (shocking in Europe!) but you can also order cappucinos or tea from the waiters. There is a computer with free internet available. Also, you have a great view of St. Peter's Basilica from the Rooftop Garden Bar. It's a great place to sit at night, except my one complaint about this hotel is from the bar there. The bartender is a complete jerk and is the slowest drink-mixer I've ever seen in my life! We ordered coffee with Bailey's, and he literally put the tiniest splash of Baileys in the cup and charged 2 euros for the coffees, but 5 euros for the Baileys which was a joke. The location is great - the buses are less than a block away. It is possible to walk to all of the main attractions (with the exception of the Vatican) if you're used to walking - wear comfortable shoes! I assume that the people who had negative experiences with this hotel were on the mid-level floors and perhaps they haven't been renovated yet. It is possible that there are huge differences because of this. But, you and your family of 3 or 4 will be very happy in any of the suites on the top floor. Enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My travel agency, Liberty Travel, booked this hotel for my husband and me. I was optimistic because Frommers gave it a good review, saying that most rooms had been renovated and the hotel boasts an art deco style. We were extremely disappointed. We love art deco. But the rooms were NOT art deco. They were simply old and worn out. I felt like I was in my grandmother's house. The furnishings looked like they hadn't been touched since 1960. Old wicker-type stuff, very drab, orange/brown/yellow drapes and carpeting. We asked for a different room. The next room was bigger, but the same shabby appearance. We threatened to leave the hotel, but unfortunately Liberty Travel would not help us because we had pre-paid. The front desk offered their "luxury suite," at first for an extrea $300 euro/night above what we were already paying, and then finally for an extra $100 euro/night. The so-called luxury suite was indeed a suite, but hardly luxury. The bedding was thread-bare, the wallpaper peeling off the walls. The decor an odd and ugly mixture of styles - again, hardly art deco. Throughout our stay we heard the same conversations taking place at the front desk - guests complaining about their rooms, only to be offered the suite at an extra $300 euro. Clearly they were pulling the bait-and-switch. The lobby was very nice and the location good if you want to be near the termini. BUt we found it very far from the tourist attractions. We would NOT recommend this hotel.
